rComments: No papers, just two midterms and a final. Exams consisted of half multiple choice and half short answers. Lectures were engaging and lots of examples were provided. Overall, I strongly recommend taking PSY2301 with Dr. Berard!

He is a very nice prof. If you attend to the lectures you can easily get an A+. There wasn't any assignment to do. Just 2 midterms & a final. Lectures are interesting & mainly about biology. Loved this course. Highly Recommended!
Professor Berard is funny and kind. His lectures are interesting and easy to understand. The midterms were very fair. My favourite class and professor of the semester.
Simply amazing, he will make you fall in love with biology and behaviour. Based on 2 midterms and one final, contains both multiple choice and short answers.

This class was my favorite as he has engaging lectures that are well organized. He moves at a fast pace but does a great job of explaining topics. The lectures are crucial to pass the course (whether the actual lecture or the PowerPoint). I would highly recommend his class.

Loved this prof in 2301, 3301 and now PSY 3377. Overall an amazing presenter, great lectures, great content, exams actually reflect what you've learned! WOW can you imagine... I absolutely recommend anyone taking these classes to have him as your professor :)
The most elaborated slides, yet still delivers the most engaging lectures! He also gives great insight to the psychology field in terms of what you can do after your degree. Highly recommended!

Professor Berard is just an amazing professor. His lectures are very engaging. He has very fair midterms that relate directly to course material, and I have felt very well prepared going into them thus far thanks to his teaching. He has first hand experience with what he teaches too outside of the school bc he works at the hospital with patients!

Great prof. Follow his online lectures with his fill in the blank powerpoints and you'll get an easy A. First midterm was long and time consuming, he adjusted the next midterm and the final accordingly to accommodate his students, great guy!

The thing I really loved about his class is how straightforward it is. Material was easy to follow - each week had 1 lecture video paired with 1 slideshow. You won't get any curveballs, confusion w content on tests, or "surprise u have 4 extra things to do this week" with him. Only con is u have to use time wisely on exams or u won't finish!
Looked forward to this class every week and wouldnt hesitate to take another class with him in the future. Great lecturer and the course covered interesting material. Solid prof.

Liked prof but lectures were dull with a lot of material. Replied to emails in 1-2 days and is very friendly, it's easy to see he loves what he teaches. If you're not great at science some of the concepts are tricky to understand but professor is very willing to help. Midterms and exam were open book for his virtual course.

Very clear and concise in the lectures. Gives great examples. Overall can't find any fault with this professor. 2021W is an easy semester since everything is open-book. As long as you've watched the weekly lectures and do a bit of studying, you're gold.

He's so nice!! His course is the definition of fair. He makes it very clear what will and won't be on tests and how much detail you need to know. His anecdotes about his work at the hospital are also nice! The only prof I've had that has offered his advice on how to get started in research, which I really appreciate. He really cares.

Took both PSY3301 & PSY2301 with him. Both amazing classes, learnt so much and he is a great lecturer. Weekly quizzes in psy2301 was very helpful, wish psy3301 had them. Exams are 90 min but can finish them in 60min. Very helpful to explain stuff additionally through email. Overall an amazing prof.

I don't have a science background at all so I was terrified of this course so much so that I waited until my 4th year to take it. I can say it was waaaay less scary then I thought. Great professor who explained things clearly. I emailed him a lot because I was so nervous about it and he always answered back and was always helpful.
Super easy class with him. He's super nice and really clear when he explains stuff in class and the tests are pretty straight forward.

Format fall 2020: asynchronous, no textbook - posted 1 vid/wk fully covering a "Topic" (+assoc. slides with "fill in the blanks"), & a short quiz due on Sundays at midnight. 3 non-cum. exams. Prof: clear, thorough explanations, quick to mark/respond, really nice dude :) Course: cool & graspable info, easy to succeed, fair exams, clear feedback!

Asynchronous, pre-recorded lectures so lots of option to work on your own time. No need for textbook as he provides all necessary details in lectures. Great at explaining content, especially if you don't have a science background. All quizzes and exams "open-book" this term.
Amazing prof, so caring for his students. Takes a hard class and makes it comprehensible for any psychology student. He's very knowledgeable about the subject and it's clear in his lectures.

AMAZING. He genuinely cares and listens to student's needs. He realized a lot of students were overwhelmed, and decided to decrease the questions per quiz. Super approachable and made sure I was accommodated. He's thorough and is clear about what he will test you on for his quizzes and midterms. If you have the chance to, TAKE HIM!!!!!

My favourite class this term. Awesome guy. Im sad the current COVID-19 situation shortened our in class time together as his lectures were amazing. He adds real world examples from his hospital work and life that really make the material clear and interesting. Exams and paper were extremely fair. Great way to finish my degree!

Awesome, caring prof! I wish I had taken the previous neuroscience courses with him. He knows a ton about the material and I feel like I learned a lot from him easily given how well he teaches. He genuinely wants you to do well. His exams really reflect the material covered with no surprises. Answers emails quickly and is so helpful.
Great prof. Very understanding and is incredibly clear about what will/will not be on midterms and exams.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Such a great prof! He really cares about his students and wants you to do well. His experience in neuropsych at the hospital makes lectures even more interesting as he sometimes adds examples illustrate what you learn. Take his class!!
He really cares about his students. He basically tells you everything that will be on his exams. If you want an A+ take this class.

Such a good prof! He breaks down the course really well, and his course really reflects what is going to be on the exam. He will give you hints and that will most definitely be on the exam. Highly recommended prof!
One of the best profs I've had. He's so caring, answers emails quickly, and tells you exactly what's on the exams. Makes a daunting class interesting and definitely possible to do well

He is the most straight-forward, caring prof I've had during university. Seriously, everything you need to know is on the slides, it's clear and he goes out of his way to help you outside of class, give extra marks and even give hints for exams. You can tell he really cares about his students. If you try in this class, you will do well!
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: He is an amazing prof who really cares about the success of his students! He is always available, replies to his emails very quickly and seriously if you take this course, take it with him. hes worth it. hes also very understanding. I missed an online quiz once and he re-opened it to help me complete it.

THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD!! This course appears to be hard and it is BUT he teaches it and makes it actually really easy to understand. Wish he taught more courses because he truly respects and understands that his students are not science majors. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Loved this guy. Wish he taught more courses. I was dreading having to take this class but he made it so clear and easy to understand. He is clearly passionate about the material and knows his stuff (especially neuropsychology and brain disorders). Super helpful during his office hours (even when chatting about things outside of class material!).

He is super clear about his expectations and makes things super easy to understand. Didn't use the textbook but needed to buy it for the launchpad quizzes (easy 10%). Overall good prof, if you have to take this class take it with him.

He's such a great prof! Very knowledgeable about this subject and it's obvious he loves it. His personal anecdotes are so interesting and he explains concepts in a way that is easy to understand. Exams reflect the course material really well, but you need to study in depth. Personally, I find him super attractive as well so that's a bonus!
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: My 2nd time taking it as I struggled with a different prof. This prof is way better. There is a lot of material & the pace is quick but I had an easier time understanding it with this guy. He knows not everyone has a science background & takes that into account. Always reachable outside of class. Highly recommend to anyone nervous about the science

Very understanding and accommodating when I needed a midterm deferred. He has condensed the course content in a way that benefits students. He also made the final non-cumulative, which helps considering there is so much content to learn. The 2 weekly online quizzesmark booster (1 is graded&can be done 3x and 2ndparticipation). Highly recommended
